entry.title: 07.06.2024: ubuntu-security
entry.content:
# UBUNTU-SECURITY

[11:46] <noob64> Hey guys, I was just doing a system apt upgrade from terminal, and towards the end I got a kind of pop up that took up most of the screen for something related to UEFI and system configuration from boot, and it wanted me to insert a password of at least 8 characters. What is this, and why did it ask for this?
[12:44] <mdeslaur> ...and he's gone
[15:18] <clarkb> out of curiousity is that an expected change?
[15:22] <mdeslaur> it's probably asking for the confirmation password to enroll the local secureboot signing keys...more info here https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UEFI/SecureBoot
[15:23] <clarkb> got it, thanks
[18:54] <rouca> mdeslaur: just send a mail about GPG
[22:20] <mdeslaur> rouca: thanks, I'll take a look monday morning
=== sdeziel_ is now known as sdeziel

# UBUNTU-MEETING

[15:00] <juliank> #startmeeting Weekly Ubuntu Foundations team

[15:11] <cpete> bdrung: thank you

[High, New] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2067120

[15:12] <waveform_> yes, but while the changes are merged upstream they're not released yet (or weren't when I checked a few days ago)
[15:12] <bdmurray> bdrung: What about the /usr/lib sandbox change?
=== waveform_ is now known as waveform
[15:13] <bdmurray> cpete: I'm out part of next pulse.
[15:14] <bdmurray> bdrung: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/apport/+bug/2067120/comments/7 for clarity
[15:14] <bdrung> bdmurray, i need to incorporate your fix (and hopefully add a test case). i'll have an apport session with schopin tomorrow where we can work on that.
[15:14] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Launchpad bug 2067120 in apport (Ubuntu) "apport-retrace crashed with subprocess.CalledProcessError in check_call(): Command '['dpkg', '-x', '/srv/vms/apport-retrace/Ubuntu 24.04/apt/var/cache/apt/archives//base-files_13ubuntu9_amd64.deb', '/tmp/apport_sandbox_zj9wto2z']' returned non-zero exit status 2." [High, New]
[15:14] <cpete> bdmurray: I'll run my ideas past you sooner then
[15:16] <bdmurray> Skia: Is there any kind of testing of the base images that can be done in jenkins / the upgrade testing?
[15:17] <bdmurray> dbungert: "RESULTS WILL VARY." I like your certainty
[15:18] <juliank> Can we continue, we have a couple of bugs?
[15:18] <juliank> #topic Release incoming bugs
[15:18] <juliank> #link http://reports.qa.ubuntu.com/reports/rls-mgr/rls-oo-incoming-bug-tasks.html#foundations-bugs
[15:18] <juliank> bug 1969394
[15:18] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 1969394 in update-manager (Ubuntu) "'Settings & Livepatch' button opens 'settings' tab, not livepatch" [Low, Confirmed] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1969394
[15:19] <juliank> This is a desktop+design topic I believe
[15:19] <juliank> Or wellr seb believes
[15:20] <vorlon> agreed
[15:20] <Skia> bdmurray: difficult to say. In that case, the image were booting, but the system just was partially broken afterwards. In any case, the tests were red, meaning we had a look at them, and fixed the issue. The answer might just be that I need to level up in debugging those tests :-)
[15:21] <juliank> bug 2063467
[15:21] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2063467 in needrestart (Ubuntu) "needrestart should mark services as needing a restart in systemd" [Undecided, New] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2063467
[15:21] <juliank> This is a simple quality of life improvement I believe
[15:21] <vorlon> I'm going to argue that's pretty low priority
[15:22] <juliank> We could mark just the services that would need restarting that we didn't
[15:22] <vorlon> compared to all the other things wrong with needrestart :)
[15:22] <vorlon> and thus shouldn't be taken for foundations
[15:22] <schopin> +1 on vorlon's remarks :)
[15:22] <juliank> Untagging
[15:22] <juliank> bug 2067350
[15:22] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2067350 in glibc (Ubuntu) "Removal of 31-bit (s390) glibc packages" [Undecided, New] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2067350
[15:24] <schopin> doko has been OOO so I think I'll JFDI in glibc in my upcoming merge.
[15:24] * bdmurray trembles
[15:24] <juliank> I'll assign it to you and tag it todo
[15:24] <schopin> bdmurray: don't worry, I'll warm up the queues first with an openssl sponsoring.
[15:24] <bdmurray> so winter isn't coming? ;-)
[15:24] <juliank> bug 2015538
[15:24] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2015538 in dbus-broker (Ubuntu) "[MIR] dbus-broker" [Undecided, Incomplete] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2015538
[15:24] <juliank> this one again
[15:25] <slyon> hehe, maybe. someday
[15:25] <vorlon> not sure why, process-wise, an MIR bug should be in the -incoming queue
[15:25] <slyon> It needs somebody doing the (upstream) work
[15:26] <schopin> vorlon: there's something that needs implementing in there, I believe.
[15:26] <juliank> vorlon: The queue part is removing the dbus-run-session dependency from gdm, basically
[15:27] <juliank> There is https://github.com/bus1/dbus-broker/pull/321
[15:27] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Pull 321 in bus1/dbus-broker "session: implement dbus-broker-session" [Open]
[15:27] <juliank> Which is written in Rust
[15:27] <juliank> So bluca doesn't want it :D
[15:28] <juliank> But I guess we can move this to rls-pp-incoming
[15:28] <juliank> And hope the solution is ready then
[15:29] <juliank> Well no objections, so moving it
[15:29] <bdmurray> petable porcupine
[15:29] <dbungert> pointed panther
[15:30] <vorlon> postulating pika
[15:30] <juliank> #link http://reports.qa.ubuntu.com/reports/rls-mgr/rls-nn-incoming-bug-tasks.html#foundations-bugs
[15:30] <juliank> bug 2066995
[15:30] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2066995 in apport (Ubuntu) "apport-gtk keeps prompting to report crashes in a loop" [High, New] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2066995
[15:30] <vorlon> please? :)
[15:31] <bdrung> assign that one to vorlon? ;)
[15:31] <vorlon> D:
[15:31] <bdrung> we need to find the root cause.
[15:31] <schopin> I'm wondering if that's not a whoopsie problem.
[15:32] <juliank> So this only affects vorlon so far and he's the only one who can investigate? :D
[15:32] <vorlon> I assume this is only because none of you are having crashes
[15:32] <juliank> And why don't we log the errno for "could not be opened"
[15:32] <schopin> Well, the looping part is all vorlon, but the failing to deal with Python crashes I also observed.
[15:32] <juliank> I don't have apport but systemd-coredump
[15:32] <juliank> :D
[15:32] <schopin> not a coredump.
[15:33] <bdmurray> cupsd and some bluetooth thing crash for me regularly
[15:33] <bdrung> juliank, you can have both now: systemd-coredump and apport
[15:33] <juliank> I guess that's true
[15:33] <vorlon> bdmurray: this is probably python specific
[15:33] <juliank> I need to set it up, bdrung
[15:33] <bdmurray> vorlon: you didn't say that in your original statement
[15:33] <juliank> Ah ok I just had no apport-gtk
[15:33] <vorlon> bdmurray: the example crash is a python thingy
[15:34] <vorlon> and the only crashes I've had here on noble have been python
[15:34] <juliank> Really need to have an "investigate bug" spike
[15:34] <vorlon> maybe y'all should just run 'grep-merges' :P
[15:34] <vorlon> merges.ubuntu.com will helpfully make this crash
[15:35] <vorlon> and then you can see if it's reproducible!
[15:35] <juliank> I just crashed apport by inserting a raise ValueError
[15:36] <juliank> Well I'll move on
[15:37] <juliank> bug 2067622
[15:37] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2067622 in ubuntu-release-upgrader (Ubuntu) "cryptsetup-initramfs disappeared during upgrade from 23.10 to 24.04 leading to failing boot" [Undecided, New] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2067622
[15:37] <bdmurray> oof
[15:37] <juliank> That seems straightforward, no, ubuntu-release-upgrader has a flag to make it protect some packages
[15:38] <juliank> Broken cryptsetup-initramfs:amd64 Depends on cryptsetup:amd64 < 2:2.7.0-1ubuntu4 @ii pgP > (>= 2:2.7.0-1ubuntu4)
[15:38] <juliank> It doesn't help that we break users by purging all packages during the upgrade
[15:39] <juliank> Assigning to Nick, targetting, and tagging
[15:39] <juliank> bug 2067916
[15:39] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2067916 in glibc (Ubuntu Noble) "libc6: broken utmp handling in 32-bit programs with 64-bit time_t" [Medium, New] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2067916
[15:39] <schopin> Ah. Yes.
[15:40] <schopin> Just wanted to discuss the severity of this.
[15:40] <juliank> If it crashes it should get fixed
[15:40] <juliank> :D
[15:40] <bdmurray> but how soon?
[15:40] <juliank> ASAR
[15:40] <schopin> Not actually sure it crashes?
[15:40] <juliank> :D
[15:41] <juliank> If the data is just garbled but not crashing that may be um not critical
[15:41] <schopin> I mean, the crash would be for last(1) and a few other tools.
[15:41] <schopin> And only if they're upgrading.
[15:42] <juliank> But yeah medium seems fine
[15:42] <vorlon> things crashing on malformed utmp would almost certainly be security issues that should have been fixed 20 years ago
[15:42] <juliank> I guess they are not setuid binaries that crash
[15:43] <juliank> Anyway I'll go tag this and assign it to schopin
[15:43] <schopin> ACK
[15:43] <schopin> to the backlog it goes :)
[15:43] <juliank> OK rls-mm just has the usual 2 desktop bugs masquerading in foundations queue :D
[15:44] <juliank> #link http://reports.qa.ubuntu.com/reports/rls-mgr/rls-jj-incoming-bug-tasks.html#foundations-bugs
[15:44] <juliank> bug 530252
[15:44] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 530252 in os-prober (Ubuntu) "os-prober fails to recognize linux installations with crypted root partition" [Undecided, Confirmed] https://launchpad.net/bugs/530252
[15:44] <juliank> This we probably should just untag, it should land via patch pilot
[15:45] <juliank> Oh I think they directly installed to a luks partition, rather than use lvm
[15:45] <schopin> Oh wow, 6 digits!
[15:45] <bdrung> schopin, 5 digits is needed for a "wow"
[15:45] <vorlon> definitely shouldn't be accepted via the incoming queue, based solely on the bug number :)(
[15:46] <juliank> Ok ff is mpty too
[15:46] <juliank> #topic Team proposed-migration report
[15:46] <juliank> #link https://ubuntu-archive-team.ubuntu.com/proposed-migration/update_excuses_by_team.html#foundations-bugs
[15:46] <juliank> vorlon:
[15:47] <vorlon> fwupd-efi is carry-over, sits with me and juliank
[15:47] <bdrung> regarding dracut blocking systemd 256~rc3-5ubuntu1: I need to merge dracut 102 to fix that.
[15:48] <vorlon> pyopenssl still stuck - adrien this was assigned to you, and I think you're still working on it wrt python-oauth2client and its revdeps?
[15:51] <vorlon> gcc-13 I see as 'candidate' but it hasn't moved. bdrung can you take this? means digging into update_output.txt
[15:51] <bdrung> vorlon, i still have dracut vs systemd
[15:51] <vorlon> dbungert: ^ can you take this?
[15:52] <vorlon> cpete: you still have libsub-override-perl yes? (MIR)
[15:52] <adrien> vorlon: yes, still on it; there's a few packages left
[15:52] <cpete> vorlon: yes
[15:52] <dbungert> ack for dracut vs systemd
[15:52] <vorlon> juliank: apt and cron, I guess this is with you
[15:52] <vorlon> ?
[15:52] <vorlon> dbungert: sorry, I meant can you take gcc-13 - leaving dracut v systemd with bdrung
[15:53] <dbungert> ah, sorry
[15:53] <dbungert> ack for gcc-13
[15:53] <juliank> vorlon: Well yes, that should sort itself out with the next apt upload
[15:53] <vorlon> git: danilogondolfo?
[15:53] <danilogondolfo> ack
[15:53] <adrien> vorlon: cinder, python-googleapi done; pydrive sorted out (removal); beancount, fence-agents, python-certbot-dns-google: need to be worked upon; pydrive2: not obvious how to deal with it (assess whether we can remove stuff from python-oauth2client and vendor?)
[15:54] <vorlon> systemd: enr0n uploaded but he's out this week. ginggs?
[15:54] <ginggs> ack
[15:54] <vorlon> and then that's the list
[15:55] <bdrung> we have fakeroot 1.35-1 that FTBFS
[15:55] <adrien> well, I have at least one revdep of python-googleapi that will need attention...
[15:55] <schopin> all arches or armhf?
[15:55] <schopin> oh, all arches. Not t64, good :)
[15:55] <bdrung> fakeroot ftbfs on all archs (except riscv64)
[15:56] <bdrung> so who want to take it?
[15:56] <bdrung> or vorlon to pick a volunteer
[15:56] <zhsj> i can take
[15:56] <vorlon> zhsj: thanks
[15:56] <zhsj> though not expect a easy fix
[15:59] <vorlon> juliank:
[15:59] <juliank> #topic AOB
[16:00] <tsimonq2> I took https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/debhelper/13.15.3ubuntu1 and https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/bash/5.2.21-2.1ubuntu1 and will follow up on p-m - if these uploads break anything please feel free to ping me.
[16:01] <juliank> #endmeeting
[16:01] <meetingology> Meeting ended at 16:01:20 UTC. Minutes at https://ubottu.com/meetingology/logs/ubuntu-meeting/2024/ubuntu-meeting.2024-06-06-15.00.moin.txt
=== Kilos-- is now known as Kilos
[19:57] <WildMan> This is WildMan
[19:57] <Kilos> hi there
[20:04] <Kilos> wb
[20:05] <WildMan> Thank you, what did I miss, Iâm having connection issues
[20:06] <Kilos> I see that. the applicant is not here yet
[20:09] <WildMan> Okay, thank you I canât see who is in the room from the web client on my cell
[20:09] <Kilos> I am watching all that start with m
[20:09] <Kilos> he is mrbright right
[20:09] <Kilos> lol or something like that
[20:16] <Kilos> WildMan: meeting is in 1 hour and 44 mins
[20:18] <WildMan> Okay please vote my proxy as I stated in our channel please, I have to go back to work
[22:06] <Kilos> hi Mrbite
[22:06] <Mrbite> Hello Team, Good to be here.
[22:06] <Mrbite> Hello Kilos
[22:07] <Bashing-om> ^ \o/ Mrbite
[22:08] <Mrbite> Bashing-om â¡ï¸
[22:15] <Kilos> Mrbite: please be patient we are just sorting some issues
[22:16] <mapreri> alright!
[22:16] <Mrbite> Alright--
[22:16] <mapreri> #startmeeting Ubuntu Membership Board
[22:16] <meetingology> Meeting started at 22:16:32 UTC. The chair is mapreri. Information about MeetBot at https://wiki.ubuntu.com/meetingology
[22:16] <meetingology> Available commands: action, commands, idea, info, link, nick
[22:16] <mapreri> #voters Kilos Bashing-om mapreri
[22:16] <meetingology> Current voters: Bashing-om, Kilos, mapreri
[22:16] <mapreri> Hello and welcome to the Ubuntu Membership Review Board meeting for June 7th 2024. The wiki page for the Review Boards is available here: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Membership/Boards
[22:17] <mapreri> Today we only have one applicant, whom is here already, and we also have a quorum, so I see no reason as to why we shouldn't be able to handle it today!
[22:17] <mapreri> Each applicant should introduce themselves (1-5 sentences) and provide links to their Ubuntu Wiki page or Ubuntu Discourse thread. After the introduction, the members of the Membership Review Board will review the pages and, if needed, ask the applicant further questions.
[22:17] <mapreri> During this time, it is encouraged for other members of the community to show their support for the applicant. Do not be alarmed if the members of the Membership Review Board are quiet during this time; they are reading wiki/launchpad/forum/other pages and deciding how they are going to vote.
[22:17] <mapreri> When the board is ready to vote, they will publicly vote in the channel with either +1, 0, or -1 (for membership, abstain, and against membership, respectively). If most of the voting board members vote +1, then the applicant is now an official Ubuntu member! (Feel free congratulate them!)
[22:17] <mapreri> Now, with any further ado, let's get started with the first applicant...
[22:17] <mapreri> #topic Bright Adams < Mrbite >
[22:18] <mapreri> Mrbite: please introduce yourself and share your links to IRC as well.
[22:20] <mapreri> Mrbite: ?
[22:22] <Mrbite> My name is Bright Adams. Am a blockchain Developer and am here to express my interest for Ubuntu membership.
[22:22] <Mrbite> Will drop links sooner.
[22:23] <Mrbite> https://discourse.ubuntu.com/c/locos/ubuntu-ng/155
[22:23] <Mrbite> This link directs you to some of our accomplishemts.
[22:24] <Mrbite> https://discourse.ubuntu.com/t/bright-adams-membership-application/44254
[22:25] <mapreri> could I ask you why on discourse you are part of the ubuntu-unity-devs team, whereas I can't find any sort of connection anywhere else (especially in lpâ¦)?
[22:27] <mapreri> also, could you confirm to us that indeed your first contribution to the community was roughly one year ago?
[22:27] <Mrbite> I really can't say how I got that tag.
[22:28] <Mrbite> Yes, roughly a year ago.
[22:28] <mapreri> ack.
[22:29] <mapreri> On discourse, you state "I am eager to continue my contributions to the Ubuntu community and to work towards its goals" - could you possibly be a bit more specific about what you'd like to engage in?
[22:30] <Bashing-om> I count 10 months contributing - with huge efforts.
[22:32] <Mrbite> Continue to contribute to the Ubuntu Comm. and further its growth.
[22:33] <Bashing-om> Mrbite: What does attaining Ubuntu membership mean to you, personally ?
[22:35] <Mrbite> Getting Ubuntu membership means a lot to me
[22:35] <Mrbite> It feels like I'm part of something bigger and important. ...Plus, it pushes me to keep learning and doing more.
[22:36] <Bashing-om> :)
[22:36] <Kilos> Mrbite: have you been to your discourse pages again ?
[22:36] <Mrbite> Not yet
[22:36] <Kilos> there are links to other countries in africa that also use ubuntu
[22:37] <Kilos> I think I collected them all in 2016 or soon after
[22:37] <Mrbite> Ye i saw the link Bashing-om sent.
[22:38] <Mrbite> Okay thats great, what do you suggest I do wit them?
[22:38] <Kilos> please follow up on them
[22:38] <Mrbite> Why are they not on the discourse?
[22:39] <Kilos> encourage them , when freenode crashed many of them left irc
[22:39] <Kilos> discourse is newish
[22:39] <Kilos> we used launchpad and the wiki before
[22:40] <Mrbite> Ohhh Thats right.
[22:40] <Mrbite> Will do just that.
[22:40] <Kilos> thank you
[22:42] <mapreri> I likewise encourage you to look a bit into a bit of "history" of the project, as there have been changes over the years (and there are still changes ongoing, like how IRC is slowly being replaced by matrix). but a community as wide as Ubuntu's can be slow to move and adapt. :)
[22:42] <mapreri> You'll easily find pieces left over from our predecessors and have been abandoned here and there... (not necessarily what you need, but some finds can be pretty interesting and amusing heh)
[22:43] <Mrbite> Ye... thats right.
[22:43] <mapreri> Kilos, Bashing-om: would you be ready to vote?
[22:43] <Mrbite> Will look into that.
[22:43] <mapreri> or would you like more time?
[22:43] <Kilos> mapreri: yip
[22:43] <Bashing-om> yup
[22:43] <Bashing-om> ready to vote.
[22:44] <mapreri> #vote Ubuntu Membership for Mrbite
[22:44] <meetingology> Please vote on: Ubuntu Membership for Mrbite
[22:44] <meetingology> Public votes can be registered by saying +1, -1 or +0 in channel (for private voting, private message me with 'vote +1|-1|+0 #channelname')
[22:44] <Bashing-om> +1
[22:44] <meetingology> +1 received from Bashing-om
[22:44] <Kilos> +1
[22:44] <meetingology> +1 received from Kilos
[22:44] <Kilos> and a +1 from wildman
[22:45] <mapreri> +1 - what you have done in this little time is honestly quite amazing, going from next to nothing to such nice meetups! However for me normally I'd consider contributions in such short timeframe not quite enough. I pretty much giving this +1 in the hope that you'll continue strong in spreading Ubuntu around Nigeria, and Africa as a whole! :)
[22:45] <meetingology> +1 - what you have done in this little time is honestly quite amazing, going from next to nothing to such nice meetups! However for me normally I'd consider contributions in such short timeframe not quite enough. I pretty much giving this +1 in the hope that you'll continue strong in spreading Ubuntu around Nigeria, and Africa as a whole! :) received from mapreri
[22:46] <mapreri> #endvote
[22:46] <meetingology> Voting ended on: Ubuntu Membership for Mrbite
[22:46] <meetingology> Votes for: 3, Votes against: 0, Abstentions: 0
[22:46] <meetingology> Motion carried
[22:46] <mapreri> #action mapreri will send out the mail and add Mrbite to the LP group
[22:46] <meetingology> ACTION: mapreri will send out the mail and add Mrbite to the LP group
[22:46] <Bashing-om> congratulation Mrbite !
[22:46] <aaronprisk> Congrats, Bright! Well deserved and keep up the great work!
[22:47] <Kilos> Mrbite: congratulations. Keep up the good work
[22:48] <Kilos> mapreri: thank you for chairing
[22:48] <mapreri> Mrbite: your @ubuntu.com alias should be working within 24 (or was it 48?) hours after being added to the ~ubuntumembers launchpad group. See https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Membership#The_Perks for all the other perks that come with this title!
[22:48] <Mrbite> Thank Youuu.
[22:48] <Mrbite> I am grateful for this.
[22:48] <mapreri> #topic closing remarks
[22:49] <mapreri> Congratulations to all the new members from this meeting!
[22:49] <Bashing-om> Mrbite: This is not free - you earned it :D
[22:49] <mapreri> Thank you also to all the Membership Board members that attended the meeting and voted for these new applicants.
[22:49] <mapreri> See you all at the next board call on June 19th, 12 UTC
[22:49] <Kilos> always a pleasure
[22:50] <mapreri> #endmeeting
[22:50] <meetingology> Meeting ended at 22:50:00 UTC. Minutes at https://ubottu.com/meetingology/logs/ubuntu-meeting/2024/ubuntu-meeting.2024-06-06-22.16.moin.txt
[22:50] <mapreri> o/
[22:50] <Bashing-om> o/
[22:51] <mapreri> ah, aaronprisk!
[22:51] <mapreri> damn, I didn't even read his message, I realized he was here only by looking at the "People present" section of the minutes u.u
[22:51] <mapreri> ahah

entry.title: 04.06.2024: ubuntu-security, ubuntu-meeting
entry.content:
# UBUNTU-SECURITY

=== chris14_ is now known as chris14
=== cpaelzer_ is now known as cpaelzer
[22:43] <hwpplayer1> sarnold: hey, I have a question. Do we have any member who contributes FSF Tech Team here ?

# UBUNTU-MEETING

=== cpaelzer_ is now known as cpaelzer
[14:30] <jbicha> o/
[14:30] <cpaelzer> hi
[14:31] <cpaelzer> #startmeeting Weekly Main Inclusion Requests status
[14:31] <meetingology> Meeting started at 14:31:01 UTC. The chair is cpaelzer. Information about MeetBot at https://wiki.ubuntu.com/meetingology
[14:31] <meetingology> Available commands: action, commands, idea, info, link, nick
[14:31] <cpaelzer> Ping for MIR meeting - didrocks joalif slyon sarnold cpaelzer jamespage ( eslerm dviererbe )
[14:31] <cpaelzer> #topic current component mismatches
[14:31] <cpaelzer> Mission: Identify required actions and spread the load among the teams
[14:31] <cpaelzer> #link https://people.canonical.com/~ubuntu-archive/component-mismatches-proposed.svg
[14:31] <cpaelzer> #link https://people.canonical.com/~ubuntu-archive/component-mismatches.svg
[14:31] <dviererbe> o/
[14:32] <cpaelzer> these all look known from last week
[14:32] <joalif> o/
[14:32] <cpaelzer> abseil -> googletest on desktop
[14:32] <eslerm> o/
[14:32] <cpaelzer> IIRC they said they will have a look
[14:32] <cpaelzer> but there was jbicha saying hi
[14:32] <cpaelzer> maybe he knows a current state
[14:33] <slyon> o/
[14:33] <cpaelzer> the other are python-inflect and pytohn-arrow pointing to pytohn-typeguard and typeshed
[14:33] <cpaelzer> that was openstack and jamespage
[14:33] <cpaelzer> I didn't see a reply
[14:33] <jbicha> I haven't looked into abseil -> googletest yet
[14:33] <cpaelzer> no problem jbicha, as long as it is in your todo-queue we are ok
[14:33] <cpaelzer> the cycle is early still :-)
[14:34] <cpaelzer> I'll send a mail to jamespage in case he missed the IRC pings
[14:34] <sarnold> good morning
[14:36] <cpaelzer> mail sent
[14:36] <cpaelzer> going on
[14:36] <cpaelzer> #topic New MIRs
[14:36] <cpaelzer> Mission: ensure to assign all incoming reviews for fast processing
[14:36] <cpaelzer> #link https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/?field.searchtext=&orderby=-date_last_updated&field.status%3Alist=NEW&field.status%3Alist=CONFIRMED&assignee_option=none&field.assignee=&field.subscriber=ubuntu-mir
[14:36] <cpaelzer> I've got mine reivewed of last week
[14:36] <cpaelzer> many others wnated to do their assignment this week IIRC
[14:36] <cpaelzer> let us look what is new
[14:37] <cpaelzer> https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/sysprof/+bug/2066269
[14:37] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Launchpad bug 2066269 in sysprof (Ubuntu) "[MIR] sysprof" [Undecided, New]
[14:37] <cpaelzer> ah, that is why jbicha is here :-)
[14:37] <jamespage> o/
[14:37] <sarnold> jbicha is always here :)
[14:37] <cpaelzer> true
[14:37] <cpaelzer> but even more
[14:37] <jbicha> I plan to finish filling out https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DesktopTeam/TestPlans/Sysprof and https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DesktopTeam/TestPlans/GnomeBuilder today
[14:38] <cpaelzer> awesome
[14:38] <cpaelzer> I can have a look at a review tomorrow
[14:38] <cpaelzer> If the test process is complete by then that would be great
[14:38] <cpaelzer> assigned myself
[14:39] <cpaelzer> #topic Incomplete bugs / questions
[14:39] <cpaelzer> Mission: Identify required actions and spread the load among the teams
[14:39] <cpaelzer> #link https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/?field.searchtext=&orderby=-date_last_updated&field.status%3Alist=INCOMPLETE_WITH_RESPONSE&field.status%3Alist=INCOMPLETE_WITHOUT_RESPONSE&field.subscriber=ubuntu-mir
[14:40] <jbicha> cpaelzer: oops, I forgot to subscribe ubuntu-mir to #2066262 and #2066272 (done now): those are deps of sysprof
[14:40] <cpaelzer> uh
[14:40] <cpaelzer> thanks jbicha
[14:40] <cpaelzer> more reviews to share then
[14:40] <jbicha> bug 2066272 bug 2066262
[14:40] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2066272 in libpanel (Ubuntu) "[MIR] libpanel" [Undecided, New] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2066272
[14:40] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2066262 in libdex (Ubuntu) "[MIR] libdex" [Undecided, New] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2066262
[14:40] <cpaelzer> liiking for volunteers now
[14:40] <cpaelzer> "looking"
[14:40] <joalif> i can have one
[14:40] <cpaelzer> I also like review volunteers though
[14:41] <cpaelzer> libdex or libpanel - any preference joalif?
[14:41] <slyon> I'm off next week, but could take one for the week after.
[14:41] <cpaelzer> btw jamespage - I saw your "o/" - sorry for sending you a mail - have you seen the two mismatches above?
[14:41] <cpaelzer> ok slyon, I think that is better than no reviewer :-)
[14:41] <joalif> libdex please
[14:42] <cpaelzer> done
[14:42] <joalif> thanks
[14:43] <cpaelzer> slyon: maybe you can come to the "needs security review" yes/no this week - to enqueue it there before you are out?
[14:43] <cpaelzer> only if it is a trivial call to make, and anything in depth is fine for when you are back
[14:43] <slyon> my "distro day" for this week is almost over, not sure if I can make that
[14:43] <sarnold> good idea :)
[14:43] <cpaelzer> WDYT slyon - is that possible - or is that breaking your planned tasks before you leave?
[14:43] <cpaelzer> slyon: ok, give it a best effort try if you can
[14:43] <slyon> ok
[14:44] <cpaelzer> not wasting time discussing it further, you see sarnold would appreciate it :-)
[14:44] <cpaelzer> no recent incomplete bug updates, going on
[14:44] <cpaelzer> #topic Process/Documentation improvements
[14:44] <cpaelzer> Mission: Review pending process/documentation pull-requests or issues
[14:44] <cpaelzer> #link https://github.com/canonical/ubuntu-mir/pulls
[14:44] <cpaelzer> #link https://github.com/canonical/ubuntu-mir/issues
[14:45] <cpaelzer> two recent contribs by eslerm
[14:45] <cpaelzer> https://github.com/canonical/ubuntu-mir/pull/57
[14:45] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Pull 57 in canonical/ubuntu-mir "vendored code: use only necessary vendored code" [Open]
[14:45] <cpaelzer> https://github.com/canonical/ubuntu-mir/pull/56
[14:45] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Pull 56 in canonical/ubuntu-mir "bug state: make MIR approvals expire/Invalid after two years if packaâ¦" [Open]
[14:46] <cpaelzer> both blocked on the older libseed spelling
[14:46] <jamespage> cpaelzer: seen
[14:46] <cpaelzer> thanks jamespage
[14:46] <cpaelzer> I like both PRs, short, concise and to the point
[14:46] <cpaelzer> slyon: has approved one already
[14:46] <slyon> just approved the 2nd one
[14:46] <cpaelzer> thanks
[14:47] <cpaelzer> I'll give both a check tomorrow
[14:47] <eslerm> thank you slyon and cpaelzer
[14:47] <cpaelzer> and if I'm +1 as well merge them and fix the silly spelling check issue
[14:47] <cpaelzer> thank you all
[14:47] <cpaelzer> going on ...
[14:47] <cpaelzer> #topic MIR related Security Review Queue
[14:47] <cpaelzer> Mission: Check on progress, do deadlines seem doable?
[14:47] <cpaelzer> Some clients can only work with one, some with the other escaping - the URLs point to the same place.
[14:47] <cpaelzer> #link https://bugs.launchpad.net/~ubuntu-security/+bugs?field.searchtext=%5BMIR%5D&assignee_option=choose&field.assignee=ubuntu-security&field.bug_reporter=&field.bug_commenter=&field.subscriber=ubuntu-mir
[14:47] <cpaelzer> #link https://bugs.launchpad.net/~ubuntu-security/+bugs?field.searchtext=[MIR]&assignee_option=choose&field.assignee=ubuntu-security&field.bug_reporter=&field.bug_commenter=&field.subscriber=ubuntu-mir
[14:47] <cpaelzer> Internal link
[14:47] <cpaelzer> - ensure your teams items are prioritized among each other as you'd expect
[14:47] <cpaelzer> - ensure community requests do not get stomped by teams calling for favors too much
[14:47] <cpaelzer> #link https://warthogs.atlassian.net/jira/software/c/projects/SEC/boards/594
[14:47] <cpaelzer> I think we had no recent additions
[14:48] <cpaelzer> any update on those in the queue for longer?
[14:48] <slyon> I reviewed bug #2067373 today. I think it can be queued for security already, while desktop works out the kinks
[14:48] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2067373 in provd (Ubuntu) "[MIR] provd" [Undecided, New] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2067373
[14:48] <cpaelzer> ok, I'm sure sarnold can add that there right?
[14:48] <sarnold> yup!
[14:48] <cpaelzer> sarnold: maybe an expectation on when s3transfer and boto3 will get started?
[14:50] <sarnold> cpaelzer: I expect one should start this week, unsure of how many more
[14:50] <cpaelzer> as long as they not continue to just wait we are ok atm I guess
[14:50] <cpaelzer> but you can expect some more to come to your queue
[14:50] <cpaelzer> like 3 of sysprof we've seen above are likely
[14:51] <cpaelzer> with that in mind, going on ...
[14:51] <cpaelzer> #topic Any other business?
[14:51] <cpaelzer> nothing from the server team atm
[14:51] <sarnold> nothing from me
[14:52] <slyon> nothing from me
[14:52] <cpaelzer> joalif: jamespage: jbicha: eslerm: anything from you?
[14:52] <cpaelzer> countdown in 10
[14:52] <joalif> nothing
[14:52] <cpaelzer> 12
[14:52] <cpaelzer> 8
[14:52] <cpaelzer> 47
[14:52] <cpaelzer> 51
[14:52] <cpaelzer> kind of now ...
[14:52] <cpaelzer> ok, thanks
[14:52] <cpaelzer> I think we are good for today
[14:52] <joalif> thanks cpaelzer all :)
[14:52] <cpaelzer> about everyone got something to work on
[14:52] <eslerm> nothing :)
[14:52] <slyon> thanks all!
[14:52] <cpaelzer> but no one got an insane amount
[14:52] <cpaelzer> that is how it should be
[14:52] <cpaelzer> thanks!
[14:53] <cpaelzer> #endmeeting
[14:53] <meetingology> Meeting ended at 14:53:05 UTC. Minutes at https://ubottu.com/meetingology/logs/ubuntu-meeting/2024/ubuntu-meeting.2024-06-04-14.31.moin.txt
[14:53] <dviererbe> Thanks everyone!
[14:53] <sarnold> thanks cpaelzer, all :)
[15:11] <slyon> sarnold: FYI: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/libpanel/+bug/2066272/comments/2
[15:11] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Launchpad bug 2066272 in libpanel (Ubuntu) "[MIR] libpanel" [Undecided, New]
[15:12] <slyon> so (probably) no need for queueing it early
[18:59] <amurray> o/
[19:02] <seb128> hey
[19:03] <amurray> hey seb128
[19:03] <seb128> hey amurray :)
[19:03] <rbasak> o/
[19:03] <seb128> Steve was supposed to chair but sent an apologies email
[19:04] <seb128> Lukasz was supposed to be backup but doesn't seem around? (let me ping him in private in case)
[19:05] <seb128> rbasak, around?
[19:05] <rbasak> Yes
[19:06] <seb128> amurray, rbasak, I think it's only the 3 of us, worth having a quick meeting still?
[19:06] <amurray> yeah I think so
[19:06] <seb128> our chair and backup chair are missing, amurray you would be next in the list following the membership order
[19:06] <amurray> no worries
[19:06] <seb128> do you want to chair/start the meeting?
[19:06] <seb128> thx
[19:07] <amurray> #startmeeting Ubuntu Technical Board
[19:07] <meetingology> Meeting started at 19:07:25 UTC. The chair is amurray. Information about MeetBot at https://wiki.ubuntu.com/meetingology
[19:07] <meetingology> Available commands: action, commands, idea, info, link, nick
[19:07] <amurray> #topic Apologies
[19:07] <amurray> vorlon sent apologies via email for the next few meetings
[19:08] <amurray> #topic Action review
[19:08] <amurray> ACTION: rbasak to open wider discussion on third-party repo policy
[19:08] <rbasak> I've been working on this.
[19:08] <rbasak> I've been editing the draft.
[19:08] <rbasak> The most recent significant changes are:
[19:09] <rbasak> 1. The requirement for the documented test plan
[19:09] <rbasak> 2. The section on specific mechanism for implementation for snaps via snap channels.
[19:09] <rbasak> These are marked in green in the draft.
[19:10] <rbasak> Final call: if you haven't provided feedback yet, I'm going to assume you're OK with the current wording (as a draft for publication for consultation; there would still be a final TB ratification step).
[19:10] <rbasak> Also please note that I've renumbered the requirements and started calling them "principles" to help with clarity
[19:10] <amurray> sounds reasonable
[19:11] <amurray> #link https://docs.google.com/document/d/1apUKR4gtOrfPGCWmtoebaQUhoy-fG8Cyo3VKJyhnpD0/edit
[19:12] <amurray> new changes lgtm fwiw
[19:12] <seb128> +1 from me also
[19:12] <rbasak> Thanks!
[19:13] <rbasak> I've also been speaking to some internal stakeholders such as snap upstream.
[19:13] <rbasak> Assuming no objections from them, I'll publish to Discourse in the next couple of weeks or so.
[19:13] <rbasak> My draft to post to Discourse is in progress in the same doc.
[19:13] <amurray> sounds good - thanks rbasak
[19:14] <amurray> (argh sorry I just realised I have a hard stop in 15 mins so will speed things up a bit - apologies)
[19:14] <amurray> ACTION: rbasak to draft a proposal of the DMB-proposed inactivity expiration policy for TB ratification
[19:14] <rbasak> This is a lower priority so I've not touched it. Please carry over.
[19:14] <seb128> (sounds fine, I don't expect there is any pending topic that should turn it into a long meeting)
[19:14] <amurray> #action rbasak to draft a proposal of the DMB-proposed inactivity expiration policy for TB ratification
[19:14] <meetingology> ACTION: rbasak to draft a proposal of the DMB-proposed inactivity expiration policy for TB ratification
[19:14] <amurray> ACTION: rbasak to get the DMB election going
[19:15] <rbasak> In progress!
[19:15] <rbasak> Hopefully you've all seen the call for nominations.
[19:15] <rbasak> I will send a reminder out tomorrow.
[19:15] <amurray> yep - thanks rbasak
[19:15] <seb128> I've seen it :)
[19:15] <amurray> ACTION: vorlon to look into scripting for packages in flavor-specific overlays
[19:15] <amurray> will carry over
[19:15] <amurray> #action vorlon to look into scripting for packages in flavor-specific overlays
[19:15] <meetingology> ACTION: vorlon to look into scripting for packages in flavor-specific overlays
[19:15] <amurray> ACTION: seb128 to continue working with SRU, AA, Release, Backporters and Security teams to document their membership process and link to it from https://wiki.ubuntu.com/TechnicalBoard#Team_Delegations
[19:16] <seb128> carry over
[19:16] <amurray> #action seb128 to continue working with SRU, AA, Release, Backporters and Security teams to document their membership process and link to it from https://wiki.ubuntu.com/TechnicalBoard#Team_Delegations
[19:16] <meetingology> ACTION: seb128 to continue working with SRU, AA, Release, Backporters and Security teams to document their membership process and link to it from https://wiki.ubuntu.com/TechnicalBoard#Team_Delegations
[19:16] <amurray> will carry over vorlon's other 2 items then as well
[19:16] <seb128> +1
[19:16] <amurray> #action vorlon to follow up on the Cinnamon 24.04 LTS Qualification re the number of contacts listed for the flavor
[19:16] <meetingology> ACTION: vorlon to follow up on the Cinnamon 24.04 LTS Qualification re the number of contacts listed for the flavor
[19:16] <amurray> #action vorlon to look into scripting for packages in flavor-specific overlays
[19:16] <meetingology> ACTION: vorlon to look into scripting for packages in flavor-specific overlays
[19:17] <amurray> (this one seems to have got dropped from the previous agenda without any outcome as I recall so I readded it)
[19:17] <amurray> #topic Scan the mailing list archive for anything we missed (standing item)
[19:17] <amurray> #link https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/technical-board/2024-March/thread.html
[19:17] <amurray> heh March...
[19:17] <amurray> #link https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/technical-board/2024-June/thread.html
[19:18] <seb128> :)
[19:18] <amurray> nothing that I can see
[19:18] <amurray> (nor for May etc)
[19:18] <amurray> #topic Check up on community bugs and techboard bugs
[19:18] <amurray> #link https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu-community/+bugs?field.assignee=techboard
[19:18] <amurray> #link https://bugs.launchpad.net/techboard
[19:18] <amurray> also nothing there
[19:18] <sil2100> o/
[19:19] <seb128> sil2100, hey, just on time for the meeting wrap :)
[19:19] <amurray> oh hey sil2100
[19:19] <sil2100> Apologies, I completely lost count of time
[19:19] <sil2100> Oh no
[19:20] <amurray> all good - main thing to know would be to raise any issues you have may with the third-party repo requirements doc asap
[19:20] <sil2100> I'll check the meeting logs, but anything high-profile I should know about?
[19:20] <sil2100> ACK
[19:20] <amurray> #topic Select a chair for the next meeting (next from https://launchpad.net/~techboard/+members)
[19:20] <sil2100> Let me open it up and have quick look now
[19:21] <amurray> #agreed next meeting chair: sil2100, backup: amurray
[19:21] <meetingology> AGREED: next meeting chair: sil2100, backup: amurray
[19:21] <seb128> I guess that would be sil2100 with backup rbasak?
[19:21] <sil2100> o/
[19:21] <seb128> amurray, you just chaired this one so you shouldn't be on the hook again
[19:22] <rbasak> +1
[19:22] <amurray> I'm not fussed (fwiw for the next while I will likely have to finish after 30mins like today so if I do chair they will be efficient meetings again)
[19:22] <amurray> #agreed next meeting chair: sil2100, backup: rbasak
[19:22] <meetingology> AGREED: next meeting chair: sil2100, backup: rbasak
[19:23] <amurray> #topic AOB
[19:23] <rbasak> I'm fine either way but it's probably better it being defined :)
[19:24] <seb128> no other topic from me
[19:24] <sil2100> Nothing from me o/
[19:25] <amurray> ok - thanks folks
[19:25] <amurray> #endmeeting
[19:25] <meetingology> Meeting ended at 19:25:07 UTC. Minutes at https://ubottu.com/meetingology/logs/ubuntu-meeting/2024/ubuntu-meeting.2024-06-04-19.07.moin.txt
[19:25] <seb128> thanks amurray! efficient meetings are the best meetings ;-)
[19:26] <amurray> cheers
[19:26] <rbasak> Thanks!
[19:26] <sil2100> Thanks!

[15:03] <meetingology> Available commands: action, commands, idea, info, link, nick
[15:03] <bdrung> #topic Lightning rounds
[15:03] <bdrung> #link https://discourse.ubuntu.com/t/foundations-team-updates-thursday-2024-05-30/45411/6
[15:05] <bdmurray> Skia: What was the kernel bug regarding autopkgtest that might have been related to bug 2063094?
[15:05] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2063094 in unattended-upgrades (Ubuntu) "unattended-upgrades is running forever" [High, Confirmed] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2063094
[15:08] <bdmurray> adrien: There was a thought that bug 2056461 might be related to your unattended-upgrades bug.
[15:08] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2056461 in linux (Ubuntu) "autopkgtest-virt-qemu on noble images sometimes hangs doing copydown" [Undecided, In Progress] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2056461
[15:09] <Skia> there, you found it, sorry for the delay, I was busy posting my status late :/
[15:10] <Skia> (I also lost some time diving into adrien's new excuse page, it looks great!)
[15:10] <adrien> oh, that's a bit surprising
[15:10] <adrien> host kernel is 6.1.0-15-amd64
[15:11] <adrien> Skia: :)
[15:11] <bdmurray> I was seeing it on noble as was apw
[15:11] <adrien> it's not the first time I see that issue but I can't tell when was the first time
[15:11] <adrien> bdmurray: considering that seb had a very different backtrace, I wouldn't be surprised there are several bugs
[15:12] <bdmurray> Hrm, I'm not seeing bug 2056461 in the changelog for our linux package though...
[15:12] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2056461 in linux (Ubuntu) "autopkgtest-virt-qemu on noble images sometimes hangs doing copydown" [Undecided, In Progress] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2056461
[15:14] <adrien> also, I'll be running dbus-monitor for a while; we'll see if something changes from there
[15:14] <bdmurray> Skia: Could you check with the kernel team about the fix?
[15:15] <Skia> sure
[15:16] <bdrung> done with reading and ready to move on?
[15:17] <bdmurray> I've finished reading
[15:17] <bdrung> #topic Release incoming bugs
[15:17] <bdrung> #link http://reports.qa.ubuntu.com/reports/rls-mgr/rls-nn-incoming-bug-tasks.html#foundations-bugs
[15:18] <bdrung> bug #2066995
[15:18] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2066995 in apport (Ubuntu) "apport-gtk keeps prompting to report crashes in a loop" [High, New] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2066995
[15:18] <schopin> No oo incoming?
[15:18] <bdrung> (doing nn before oo)
[15:19] <bdrung> that bug needs triaging.
[15:20] <bdrung> schopin, could you have a look at it?
[15:21] <schopin> hem, that's a weird one?
[15:22] <bdrung> yes
[15:23] <bdrung> should we keep it in incoming until next week to have it triaged by then?
[15:23] <schopin> OK with me. I'll spend some time looking over the logs in details.
[15:24] <bdrung> ok. next: bug #2067120
[15:24] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2067120 in apport (Ubuntu) "apport-retrace crashed with subprocess.CalledProcessError in check_call(): Command '['dpkg', '-x', '/srv/vms/apport-retrace/Ubuntu 24.04/apt/var/cache/apt/archives//base-files_13ubuntu9_amd64.deb', '/tmp/apport_sandbox_zj9wto2z']' returned non-zero exit status 2." [High, New] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2067120
[15:25] <bdrung> @bdmurray, i suggested a fix for what i could see. Can you test if that fixes it for you as well?
[15:25] <bdrung> IMO we can tag this one as foundations-todo
[15:25] <bdmurray> bdrung: I will test it today
[15:26] <bdrung> okay. tagged.
[15:27] <bdrung> bug #2063094
[15:27] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2063094 in unattended-upgrades (Ubuntu) "unattended-upgrades is running forever" [High, Confirmed] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2063094
[15:31] <bdrung> this is the bug @Skia talked about previously
[15:32] <bdrung> should we tag it? it looks important enough to me and @adrien provided logs (i did not look into unattended-upgrades-bt.tar.xz)
[15:33] <ogayot> I also think we should tag it
[15:34] <bdrung> tagged
[15:34] <Skia> I think it's bdmurray that mentionned it, I don't have any context on this one, but I only know that it might be linked to LP#2056461 that I investigated from a very different angle
[15:34] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Launchpad bug 2056461 in linux (Ubuntu) "autopkgtest-virt-qemu on noble images sometimes hangs doing copydown" [Undecided, In Progress] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2056461
[15:34] <schopin> do we have enough to debug it?
[15:34] <bdmurray> Based of what adrien said I'm somewhat concerned issues are being conflated here
[15:35] <adrien> I'm a bit surprised with the stacks I've been seeing: I would have assumed they don't take CPU time
[15:36] <adrien> maybe the same operation fails repeatedly and is re-tried however
[15:36] <adrien> but I was also planning to wait for Julian to look at the traces before thinking more about the issue
[15:36] <bdrung> adrien, will you carry that bug forward?
[15:37] <bdrung> next: bug #2067071
[15:37] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2067071 in ubuntu-release-upgrader (Ubuntu) "cannot upgrade from 23.10 to 24.04, error in _install_t64_replacement_packages" [High, Confirmed] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2067071
[15:37] <bdrung> oh, i see "TypeError: apport_excepthook() missing 1 required positional argument: 'exc_tb'" in there
[15:38] <bdrung> the python stack trace looks simple enough to debug that. any objections to tagging it?
[15:38] <adrien> bdrung: no, I don't have time for that, especially since I'm not familiar with that and also since python-auth2client will be quite some work
[15:39] <bdmurray> Let's hold leave the uanttended-upgrades bug for next week then
[15:39] <bdmurray> enr0n: Are there any duplicates of bug 2067071?
[15:39] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2067071 in ubuntu-release-upgrader (Ubuntu) "cannot upgrade from 23.10 to 24.04, error in _install_t64_replacement_packages" [High, Confirmed] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2067071
[15:39] <enr0n> Yeah we should definitely take this. I wanted Julian's input on why the _cand would be None
[15:39] <enr0n> bdmurray: maybe, but I have not had time yet to go through all the recent bug reports
[15:40] <bdrung> tagged
[15:40] <bdrung> #link http://reports.qa.ubuntu.com/reports/rls-mgr/rls-oo-incoming-bug-tasks.html#foundations-bugs
[15:40] <bdrung> bug #2063204
[15:40] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2063204 in livecd-rootfs (Ubuntu) "Desktop-Live ships /etc/netplan/01-network-manager-all.yaml in addition to /usr/lib/netplan/00-network-manager-all.yaml" [Medium, New] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2063204
[15:42] <bdrung> looks like there is a foundation discussion how to address it. objections to tagging it?
[15:45] <bdrung> tagged then.
[15:45] <bdrung> bug #1969394
[15:45] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 1969394 in update-manager (Ubuntu) "'Settings & Livepatch' button opens 'settings' tab, not livepatch" [Low, Confirmed] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1969394
[15:46] <bdmurray> that might be more desktop
[15:46] <bdrung> Seems more like an UI task that we can leave to the desktop team
[15:46] <bdrung> bug #2063467
[15:46] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2063467 in needrestart (Ubuntu) "needrestart should mark services as needing a restart in systemd" [Undecided, New] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2063467
[15:48] <bdrung> leaving it for next week for juliank to be back
[15:48] <bdrung> bug #2067350
[15:48] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2067350 in glibc (Ubuntu) "Removal of 31-bit (s390) glibc packages" [Undecided, New] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2067350
[15:49] <bdrung> looks valid to me. schopin should we tag it?
[15:50] <schopin> as far as glibc is concerned I'm OK with this, but I'd like doko's ACK on it for the gcc part?
[15:50] <bdrung> schopin, can you get dokos response in the ticket? then let's keep it till next week.
[15:51] <bdrung> bug #2015538
[15:51] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2015538 in dbus-broker (Ubuntu) "[MIR] dbus-broker" [Undecided, Incomplete] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2015538
[15:51] <bdrung> leave that to the desktop team
[15:51] <bdrung> #link http://reports.qa.ubuntu.com/reports/rls-mgr/rls-mm-incoming-bug-tasks.html#foundations-bugs
[15:51] <bdrung> bug #2041518
[15:51] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2041518 in gtk+3.0 (Ubuntu) "/usr/share/apport/apport-gtk:5:_g_log_abort:g_log_writer_default:g_log_structured_array:g_log_structured_array:g_log_structured_standard" [Undecided, New] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2041518
[15:52] <bdrung> that is for the desktop team as well
[15:52] <bdrung> bug #2041831
[15:52] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2041831 in update-manager (Ubuntu) "/usr/bin/update-manager:11:g_type_check_instance_is_fundamentally_a:g_object_ref:gdk_event_copy:pygi_boxed_copy_in_place:arg_boxed_to_py_cleanup" [Undecided, New] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2041831
[15:52] <bdrung> same here
[15:52] <bdrung> #link http://reports.qa.ubuntu.com/reports/rls-mgr/rls-jj-incoming-bug-tasks.html#foundations-bugs
[15:52] <bdrung> nothing for foundations
[15:53] <bdrung> #link http://reports.qa.ubuntu.com/reports/rls-mgr/rls-ff-incoming-bug-tasks.html#foundations-bugs
[15:53] <bdrung> same here. nothing for foundations
[15:53] <bdrung> #topic Team proposed-migration report
[15:53] <bdrung> #link https://ubuntu-archive-team.ubuntu.com/proposed-migration/update_excuses_by_team.html#foundations-bugs
[15:55] <adrien> I started on the python-oauth2client and I think removal is doable but it will take some time as revdeps are not updated in packages :/
[15:56] <bdrung> fwupd-efi: vorlon (carry over from last week)
[15:56] <bdrung> pyopenssl: adrien (carry over from last week)
[15:57] <bdrung> gcc-13-cross: vorlon (carry over from last week)
[15:57] <bdrung> libsub-override-perl: cpete (carry over from last week)
[15:58] <bdrung> ncurses: zhsj
[15:59] <bdrung> openssl vs nodejs: that screems adrien or should i pick someone else?
[15:59] <adrien> bdrung: "yeah"
[15:59] <zhsj> ack
[16:00] <bdrung> dracut: me
[16:00] <adrien> it's expected that openssl 3.2 will fix it
[16:00] <adrien> (IIUC)
[16:00] <bdrung> netplan.io: the netplan team
[16:01] <bdrung> systemd vs the rest of the world: enr0n (carry over from last week)
[16:02] <bdrung> cryptsetup: schopin
[16:02] <bdrung> curl vs nodejs: ogayot
[16:02] <ogayot> bdrung: ack
[16:03] <bdrung> sphinx: mkukri
[16:03] <mkukri> ack
[16:03] <bdrung> apt: juliank
[16:04] <mkukri> isnt juliank ooo?
[16:04] <bdrung> dhcpcd: dbungert
[16:05] <dbungert> ack
[16:05] <bdrung> juliank, is ooo but will be back next week
[16:06] <schopin> (belated ack for cryptsetup)
[16:06] <bdrung> lzo2: dviererbe
[16:06] <dviererbe> ack
[16:07] <bdrung> now reaching the fresh ones
[16:07] <bdrung> all that did not get one can be happv
[16:07] <bdrung> #topic AOB
[16:08] <bdrung> speak now or forever hold your peace
[16:08] <bdrung> #endmeeting
[16:08] <meetingology> Meeting ended at 16:08:59 UTC. Minutes at https://ubottu.com/meetingology/logs/ubuntu-meeting/2024/ubuntu-meeting.2024-05-30-15.03.moin.txt
[16:09] <Skia> thanks!
[16:21] <adrien> mkukri: I take it that cryptsetup thing is not related to openssl >= 3.2 ?
[16:28] <mkukri> merging cryptsetup requires new openssl. unless someone else uploaded a cryptsetup the regression should be unrelated
[16:44] <adrien> mkukri: ok, thanks

entry.title: 28.05.2024: ubuntu-security, ubuntu-meeting
entry.content:
# UBUNTU-SECURITY

=== chris14_ is now known as chris14
=== cpaelzer_ is now known as cpaelzer
[12:03] <halloy5845> anyone here working as ubuntu security engineer? 
[12:07] <halloy5845> trippeh: hi
[12:08] <ebarretto> halloy5845, how can we help?
[15:03] <Asif> Hi, I opened bug 2066363 last week. Any chance someone can take a quick look >
[15:24] <leosilva> hi Asif, can i make the bug public, so the desktop team can see it?
[15:27] <Asif> yeah, go ahead. Nothing secret on there right now
[15:28] <Asif> Just saw your comment, its not on the gnome login window. credentials are shown on a console screen before you while the system switches back to the login screen
[15:28] <leosilva> thanks!
[15:40] <mdeslaur> Asif: those are the credentials you typed into gdm though, right?
[15:41] <Asif> yes, the last credentials typed into gdm are what is on the screen
[15:42] <Asif> We are using AD authentication with sssd 

# UBUNTU-MEETING

=== cpaelzer_ is now known as cpaelzer
[14:30] <sarnold> good morning
[14:31] <cpaelzer> hiho
[14:31] <cpaelzer> getting ready ...
[14:31] <joalif> o/
[14:31] <slyon> l/
[14:31] <slyon> o/*
[14:31] <eslerm> o/
[14:32] <cpaelzer> sorry - 1m
[14:33] <cpaelzer> #startmeeting Weekly Main Inclusion Requests status
[14:33] <meetingology> Meeting started at 14:33:29 UTC. The chair is cpaelzer. Information about MeetBot at https://wiki.ubuntu.com/meetingology
[14:33] <meetingology> Available commands: action, commands, idea, info, link, nick
[14:34] <cpaelzer> Ping for MIR meeting - didrocks joalif slyon sarnold cpaelzer jamespage ( eslerm dviererbe )
[14:34] <cpaelzer> #topic current component mismatches
[14:34] <cpaelzer> Mission: Identify required actions and spread the load among the teams
[14:34] <cpaelzer> #link https://people.canonical.com/~ubuntu-archive/component-mismatches-proposed.svg
[14:34] <cpaelzer> #link https://people.canonical.com/~ubuntu-archive/component-mismatches.svg
[14:34] <cpaelzer> welcome to a new cycle, all the sprinting and stuff made me be late
[14:34] <cpaelzer> I hope you handled all that is caused by syncs last week :-P
[14:35] <cpaelzer> ok
[14:35] <cpaelzer> no MIR bugs, so we need to bring them up
[14:35] <cpaelzer> first: abseil -> googletest
[14:35] <cpaelzer> abseil = desktop
[14:35] <slyon> It's a recommends, sho should probably be dropped to suggests..
[14:35] <cpaelzer> jbicha: didrocks: ^^ would you have a look there?
[14:36] <cpaelzer> https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/abseil/20230802.1-4
[14:36] <cpaelzer> the diff only speaks about build depends
[14:36] <cpaelzer> and it is probably a test dependency
[14:36] <cpaelzer> next
[14:37] <cpaelzer> python-pint -> requirejs and pydata-sphinx-theme
[14:37] <cpaelzer> reads like documentation
[14:37] <cpaelzer> jamespage: that is openstack
[14:37] <cpaelzer> jamespage: could one of you have a look?
[14:37] <cpaelzer> https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/python-pint/0.23-1
[14:38] <cpaelzer> yep
[14:38] <cpaelzer> it is the doc package
[14:38] <cpaelzer> https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/lunar/amd64/python-pint-doc/0.19.2-1
[14:38] <cpaelzer> vs
[14:38] <cpaelzer> https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/oracular/amd64/python-pint-doc/0.23-1
[14:39] <cpaelzer> just an exclude rule would be enough
[14:39] <cpaelzer> there is no strict reason for the doc package to be in main
[14:39] <cpaelzer> next
[14:39] <cpaelzer> python-inflect ->python-typeguard
[14:39] <cpaelzer> jamespage: also openstack
[14:40] <cpaelzer> but here it is a new real dependency
[14:40] <cpaelzer> https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/oracular/amd64/python3-inflect/7.2.1-1
[14:40] <cpaelzer> last but not least
[14:40] <cpaelzer> python-arrow -> typeshed
[14:40] <cpaelzer> and another one for openstack jamespage
[14:40] <cpaelzer> I feel you just synced them all :-)
[14:41] <cpaelzer> changed from https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/oracular/amd64/python3-arrow/1.2.3-1 to https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/oracular/amd64/python3-arrow/1.3.0-1
[14:41] <cpaelzer> python3-typing-extensions -> python3-typeshed
[14:41] <cpaelzer> ok, component mismatches done
[14:42] <cpaelzer> jamespage: will wake up to a lot of pings ... :-/
[14:42] <cpaelzer> #topic New MIRs
[14:42] <cpaelzer> Mission: ensure to assign all incoming reviews for fast processing
[14:42] <cpaelzer> #link https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/?field.searchtext=&orderby=-date_last_updated&field.status%3Alist=NEW&field.status%3Alist=CONFIRMED&assignee_option=none&field.assignee=&field.subscriber=ubuntu-mir
[14:42] <cpaelzer> two for us
[14:42] <cpaelzer> https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/malcontent/+bug/1892456
[14:42] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Launchpad bug 1892456 in malcontent (Ubuntu) "[MIR] malcontent" [Medium, New]
[14:42] <cpaelzer> had a MIR and security review in the past
[14:43] <cpaelzer> but the package changed a lot since
[14:43] <cpaelzer> so the ask is for a re-review
[14:43] <cpaelzer> I can take one
[14:43] <cpaelzer> next
[14:43] <cpaelzer> https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/provd/+bug/2067373
[14:43] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Launchpad bug 2067373 in provd (Ubuntu) "[MIR] provd" [Undecided, New]
[14:43] <slyon> I can take one for next week, too
[14:44] <cpaelzer> thanks , assigned
[14:44] <cpaelzer> #topic Incomplete bugs / questions
[14:44] <cpaelzer> Mission: Identify required actions and spread the load among the teams
[14:44] <cpaelzer> #link https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/?field.searchtext=&orderby=-date_last_updated&field.status%3Alist=INCOMPLETE_WITH_RESPONSE&field.status%3Alist=INCOMPLETE_WITHOUT_RESPONSE&field.subscriber=ubuntu-mir
[14:44] <cpaelzer> sysprof is still with jbicha for now
[14:44] <cpaelzer> the others are pre sprint AFAICS
[14:45] <cpaelzer> #topic Process/Documentation improvements
[14:45] <cpaelzer> Mission: Review pending process/documentation pull-requests or issues
[14:45] <cpaelzer> #link https://github.com/canonical/ubuntu-mir/pulls
[14:45] <cpaelzer> #link https://github.com/canonical/ubuntu-mir/issues
[14:45] <cpaelzer> some older ones that are stuck
[14:45] <cpaelzer> we might mark them as that .. hmm
[14:46] <cpaelzer> we need wording for https://github.com/canonical/ubuntu-mir/issues/51
[14:46] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Issue 51 in canonical/ubuntu-mir "cargo vendor adds unnecessary crates" [Open]
[14:46] <cpaelzer> eslerm: do you think you could provide a PR that wraps the consensus mentioned by slyon into words
[14:46] <eslerm> I can
[14:46] <cpaelzer> thanks in advance
[14:47] <cpaelzer> https://github.com/canonical/ubuntu-mir/issues/55
[14:47] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Issue 55 in canonical/ubuntu-mir "end-of-cycle unexpected changes" [Open]
[14:47] <cpaelzer> has tackled the obvious things
[14:47] <cpaelzer> the rest is "looking for volunteers" to tackle more
[14:47] <cpaelzer> speak up if anyone wants to ... :-)
[14:48] <eslerm> possibly, we could add that an owning teams director needs to request late MIRs
[14:48] <eslerm> we had a last second libyuv request, which ended up not beeing needed after ack'd
[14:49] <sarnold> there's a few cases to care for -- one with the "the team didn't plan" and then the "oh upstream or debian has walked away from package foo because they're switching to package bar"
[14:49] <sarnold> i think our "you get to talk to the director of security engineering" is a decent speedbump to discourage the first one, but I wish we could come up with some clever ideas to spot the overlooked packages
[14:50] <cpaelzer> I'm happy with adding "bring high level for late requests"
[14:50] <cpaelzer> bring wording in a PR for that for discussion please
[14:50] <cpaelzer> for the other case let us brainstorm for 3 minutes ...
[14:51] <cpaelzer> It plays into the "re-evaluate things in main" TBH
[14:51] <cpaelzer> which we asked for but got denied for resourcing
[14:51] <eslerm> that's not what I mean with #22
[14:51] <sarnold> storm idea one, look for new Replaces: or maybe dropped Depends: from other packages?
[14:52] <eslerm> it is for cases where there is ack for the MIR, but then owning team goes idle for a long period of time (say 2 years)
[14:52] <eslerm> I am okay dropping issue though
[14:52] <sarnold> storm idea two, look for new packages with small levenstein distances from packages already in main
[14:52] <cpaelzer> sarnold: I think we usually get signal by bugs, the cases I see crashing as where responsibility and ownership is unclear.
[14:52] <cpaelzer> sarnold: which does not mean I'd not like a scanner that provides extra signal
[14:53] <cpaelzer> eslerm: now I got you - like "what is the consequence if they make us busy and then walk away" ?
[14:53] <cpaelzer> eslerm: I'm not sure, but things change - so that can not always be prevented IMHO.
[14:54] <cpaelzer> eslerm: not sure if defining negative consequences would help, or did you have something completely different in mind?
[14:54] <eslerm> mostly, this occured and then a package was added to main, and I believe it should have had a quick re-review first
[14:54] <eslerm> it's not about negative consequences for us doing the work, just that more work is needed if a review has gone "stale"
[14:55] <slyon> so adding something like a timeout on an ACK?
[14:55] <eslerm> yes, I proposed 2 years
[14:56] <slyon> sounds reasonable to me.
[14:56] <cpaelzer> I'm +1 on timeout on an Ack
[14:56] <slyon> cpaelzer: that would be like our re-review idea, but only for things that didn't make it into "main" yet.
[14:57] <cpaelzer> While we do not get a re-review, if it didn't make it into main it is fine to time out
[14:57] <cpaelzer> slyon: exactly
[14:57] <cpaelzer> anyone willing to provide a wording PR for that?
[14:57] <eslerm> I can propose a PR
[14:57] <cpaelzer> thank you
[14:57] <cpaelzer> uh, time flies
[14:57] <cpaelzer> let us go on ...
[14:57] <cpaelzer> #topic MIR related Security Review Queue
[14:57] <cpaelzer> Mission: Check on progress, do deadlines seem doable?
[14:57] <cpaelzer> Some clients can only work with one, some with the other escaping - the URLs point to the same place.
[14:57] <cpaelzer> #link https://bugs.launchpad.net/~ubuntu-security/+bugs?field.searchtext=%5BMIR%5D&assignee_option=choose&field.assignee=ubuntu-security&field.bug_reporter=&field.bug_commenter=&field.subscriber=ubuntu-mir
[14:57] <cpaelzer> #link https://bugs.launchpad.net/~ubuntu-security/+bugs?field.searchtext=[MIR]&assignee_option=choose&field.assignee=ubuntu-security&field.bug_reporter=&field.bug_commenter=&field.subscriber=ubuntu-mir
[14:57] <cpaelzer> Internal link
[14:57] <cpaelzer> - ensure your teams items are prioritized among each other as you'd expect
[14:57] <cpaelzer> - ensure community requests do not get stomped by teams calling for favors too much

[14:59] <cpaelzer> eslerm: and thanks for your many great contributions

[14:59] <cpaelzer> fair
[14:59] <cpaelzer> ok, the queue looks good

entry.title: 27.05.2024: ubuntu-security, ubuntu-meeting
entry.content:
# UBUNTU-SECURITY

[00:07] <amurray> mcphail: fyi I'm expecting this to be resolved in more like 7 days than a couple of weeks - so will keep pushing on things internally and let you know asap - again, apologies for all the delays on this 
[00:12] <amurray> blahdeblah: yeah that is a great idea - it would be really interesting to do the analysis to (hopefully) show that since we rebase our kernels on the various stable trees etc that we do not suffer from this
[00:13] <blahdeblah> amurray: Yeah, my feeling after reading it was similar, and I did question their methodology a bit, but not being an expert in the area I couldn't be definitive.
[00:15] <amurray> or perhaps it would be enough just to compare open CVEs in our kernels vs RHEL (but in general I don't think anything good ever comes of doing direct comparisons with our peers, particularly if we do it and then try and say - "look how much more secure we are") - instead would just be good to show an analysis that reassures users that Ubuntu *is* secure since we do incorporate all the patches and leave out the comparison bit
=== chris14_ is now known as chris14
[07:58] <blahdeblah> amurray: +1
[08:17] <mcphail> amurray: thanks again
[19:30] <ahasenack> georgiag: hi, I just had a bug filed about something I wasn't expecting in apparmor rules,
[19:30] <ahasenack> georgiag: impact of usr-merge in apparmor profiles, when ugprading from pre-usr-merge distros
[19:30] <ahasenack> case in point was bionic -> focal upgrade
[19:30] <ahasenack> in fresh bionic: /bin/uname
[19:30] <ahasenack> in fresh focal: /usr/bin/uname
[19:31] <ahasenack> in focal upgraded from bionic: /bin/uname
[19:31] <ahasenack> (uname is just an example: anything in /bin/ in bionic, if present in an apparmor rule that does not use /{,usr/}, will fail in the upgraded system
[19:32] <ahasenack> I had a nice "%if bionic" in the apparmor template, and was accounting for these differences where needed, but always assuming the "fresh" installation case
[19:32] <ahasenack> this upgrade-from-bionic got me
[19:33] <ahasenack> do you remember similar bugs back in 2020 (focal's release), from people upgrading from bionic to focal? Just trying to get some an idea if there is a pattern to addressing this
[19:34] <georgiag> ahasenack: I will have to dig a little bit to find out if there are/were other cases.
[19:34] <ahasenack> no need, if you don't remember, then they were likely not important or relevant
[19:35] <georgiag> I had this issue in one of the apparmor tests actually
[19:35] <ahasenack> or common
[19:36] <georgiag> I joined in 2021 so there might be some cases I haven't looked at yet :)
[19:36] <ahasenack> hah :)
[19:42] <sdeziel> in custom made profile, this usr-merge difference on dist-upgraded machines also bit me, annoying ;)
[19:42] <ahasenack> yeah
[19:42] <ahasenack> I'm going over every bin invocation
[19:42] <ahasenack> so far it's ps and uname
[19:42] <ahasenack> ah, and systemctl
[19:43] <ahasenack> these live in /bin in bionic

# UBUNTU-MEETING

[23:31] <arraybolt3> This is the Ubuntu Security Team's development and collaboration room, #ubuntu is the user technical support room.

entry.content:
# UBUNTU-SECURITY

=== chris14_ is now known as chris14
=== wete_ is now known as wete
[11:44] <mcphail> Hi. WRT cve-2024-1724 again, this was disclosed 20th Feb, patched 13th March and fix deployed through April. I haven't had any communication from the upstream team about disclosure, so unless there is a compelling and credible reason not to I intend to publish a wee blog post tomorrow.
[11:44] -ubottu:#ubuntu-security- ** RESERVED ** This candidate has been reserved by an organization or individual that will use it when announcing a new security problem. When the candidate has been publicized, the details for this candidate will be provided. <https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2024-1724>
[11:48] <ebarretto> amurray, ^
[11:50] <ebarretto> mcphail, have you seen the email thread answer from amurray ?
[11:53] <mcphail> ebarretto: no - haven't been included in any emails since 12th April where Alex had suggested an update in a few days
[11:54] <ebarretto> mcphail, yes, that's the one. I think they still need a couple more days. amurray might be able to confirm tomorrow as he is already EOD by now I think 
[11:58] <mcphail> Ok, thanks ebarretto. Happy to hold off if there is progress but coming up to a very busy period at work just now and keen to get simple things tidied up
[13:08] <amurray> mcphail: apologies again .. I'm just checking once more with the associated development team (my contact their appears to be offline atm and I'm about to go to bed myself but will post back in my morning what their response is)
[13:39] <mcphail> Thanks amurray . Sorry to keep troubling you
[16:51] <UnivrslSuprBox> There's a change in `apparmor (4.0.1-0ubuntu1) oracular` described as "Add condition in policydb serialization to only encode xtable if kernel_supports_permstable32". This change allows oracular's apparmor_parser to load `abstractions/opencl-pocl` on Ubuntu kernel 5.15 from jammy. noble's apparmor_parser cannot load that abstraction into jammy's kernel.
[16:51] <UnivrslSuprBox> I unfortunately have a usecase where I'm doing just that (loading noble's policy into jammy's kernel) which I know is worth telling me to go away for
[16:52] <UnivrslSuprBox> But, is that change candidate for backport from oracular to noble?
[16:53] <ebarretto> georgiag, ^
[16:55] <UnivrslSuprBox> Happy to file bugs and do any needful there, but I didn't want to start with that if the answer here was "kindly go pound sand" :P
[17:04] <georgiag> UnivrslSuprBox: yes, that change is on its way onto the noble apparmor package. we had to wait until it was in oracular to start the SRU process. I'm tracking the SRU here https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/apparmor/+bug/2064672
[17:04] -ubottu:#ubuntu-security- Launchpad bug 2064672 in apparmor (Ubuntu) "[SRU] - fixes for apparmor on noble" [Undecided, New]
[17:06] <georgiag> UnivrslSuprBox: that scenario is not that uncommon given that you could have a noble lxd container running on jammy, which would be using jammy's kernel... if you need it urgently, you could use the ppa I linked in the bug https://launchpad.net/~georgiag/+archive/ubuntu/apparmor-4.0.1-redo/+packages, since it's going to take a couple of weeks to complete the SRU process
[17:06] <UnivrslSuprBox> Oh, excellent. Thank you!
[17:06] <georgiag> UnivrslSuprBox: no problem. let me know if you run into any issues
[19:17] <ahasenack> uh, expat 2.6.2 has this interesting Changes entry: https://github.com/libexpat/libexpat/blob/R_2_6_2/expat/Changes#L14
[19:17] <ahasenack> "(help with) fixing a complex non-public security issue"
[19:38] <arraybolt3> ahasenack: mmm, mystery critical bugs are the best ones
[19:38] <ahasenack> for whom? :)
[20:58] <sarnold> yikes

[19:13] <seb128> would still be nice to see that raised and changed if possible though

entry.title: 10.05.2024: ubuntu-security, ubuntu-meeting
entry.content:
# UBUNTU-SECURITY

[00:14] <Unit193> Debian confirmed/concluded that the one of the recent CVEs filed against tinyproxy is a duplicate of one already fixed in stable and in Ubuntu's LTS, https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=1070395#12. It'd be good if Ubuntu could mark CVE-2023-40533 as a duplicate of CVE-2022-40468 too.
[00:14] -ubottu:#ubuntu-security- Debian bug 1070395 in src:tinyproxy "tinyproxy: CVE-2023-49606" [Grave, Fixed]
[00:14] -ubottu:#ubuntu-security- ** REJECT ** This CVE ID is a duplicate of CVE-2022-40468 <https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-40533>
[00:14] -ubottu:#ubuntu-security- Potential leak of left-over heap data if custom error page templates containing special non-standard variables are used. Tinyproxy commit 84f203f and earlier use uninitialized buffers in process_request() function. <https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2022-40468>
[00:14] <Unit193> Oh, hah.
[00:16] <Unit193> That still leaves CVE-2023-49606 open anyway, which is far more critical.
[00:16] -ubottu:#ubuntu-security- A use-after-free vulnerability exists in the HTTP Connection Headers parsing in Tinyproxy 1.11.1 and Tinyproxy 1.10.0. A specially crafted HTTP header can trigger reuse of previously freed memory, which leads to memory corruption and could lead to remote code execution. An attacker needs to make an unauthenticated HTTP request to trigger this vulnerability. <https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-49606>
[00:16] <Unit193> (https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/tinyproxy/1.11.1-4)

[15:01] <juliank> #startmeeting Weekly Ubuntu Foundations team
[15:01] <meetingology> Meeting started at 15:01:43 UTC. The chair is juliank. Information about MeetBot at https://wiki.ubuntu.com/meetingology
[15:01] <meetingology> Available commands: action, commands, idea, info, link, nick
[15:01] <juliank> #topic Lightning rounds
[15:01] <juliank> #link https://discourse.ubuntu.com/t/foundations-team-updates-thursday-2024-05-02/
[15:02] <juliank> Most forgot so I guess um 5 minutes only today because not much to read
[15:03] * juliank has blacked out a bit as to what happened this week
[15:04] <juliank> Holiday yesterday sure did not help
[15:04] <bdrung> lost all memory after first of May?
[15:04] <juliank> yeah
[15:06] <juliank> Questions, comments, additional memories recovered?
[15:07] <bdrung> Recovered memory: I worked on the sponsoring report generation.
[15:07] <juliank> When can we finally get https again for reports.qa.ubuntu.com? This is adding minutes of extra effort trying to convince firefox with https forced to downgrade
[15:07] <dbungert> mateus-morais: "are not Canonical owned" - I assume that should be "are now Canonical owned" ?
[15:08] <vorlon> juliank: you probably need to ask Brian to follow up on this
[15:08] <mateus-morais> dbungert: oops, yeah, fixing now, thanks!
[15:08] <juliank> vorlon: yeah
[15:08] <juliank> #topic Release incoming bugs
[15:08] <bdrung> juliank, when we setup letsencrypt (in a session in Madrid?)
[15:09] <juliank> We do not have oo yet
[15:09] <juliank> #link http://reports.qa.ubuntu.com/reports/rls-mgr/rls-nn-incoming-bug-tasks.html#foundations-bugs
[15:09] <juliank> bug 2061214 I should untag, sorry
[15:09] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2061214 in software-properties (Ubuntu Noble) "[SRU] Software Sources is not compatible with deb822" [Critical, Fix Committed] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2061214
[15:09] <juliank> (that was the software-properties-qt shenanigan)
[15:10] <juliank> vorlon: I suppose we can delete src:software-properties-qt in oracular now, should be superseded by new binary software-properties-qt from software-properties
[15:10] <vorlon> sure, checking
[15:10] <juliank> bug 2063094 so far we don't have actionable intel on, waiting for it to happen to me or tracking
[15:11] <juliank> ubottu: .
[15:11] <juliank> It dead
[15:11] <juliank> Oh I guess Launchpad is the one that is dead
[15:11] <vorlon> juliank: it's not superseded yet, software-properties 0.99.49 is still in -proposed
[15:11] <juliank> ah
[15:11] <juliank> let's try again
[15:11] <juliank> bug 2063094 so far we don't have actionable intel on, waiting for it to happen to me or tracking
[15:12] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2063094 in unattended-upgrades (Ubuntu) "unattended-upgrades is running forever" [High, Confirmed] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2063094
[15:12] <juliank> (seb is collecting data it happens a lot to him)
[15:12] <juliank> bug 2063128
[15:12] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2063128 in ubuntu-release-upgrader (Ubuntu) "Upgrade from mantic to noble shows a debconf prompt" [Undecided, New] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2063128
[15:13] <vorlon> should be fixed in the package popping the prompt, not worked around in u-r-u
[15:13] <vorlon> so decline
[15:13] <juliank> ah so if it is a new prompt we should not ask it on upgrades
[15:14] <juliank> launchpad is not responsive
[15:14] <vorlon> it is for me
[15:14] <vorlon> I've commented the bug and marked the u-r-u task wontfix
[15:15] <juliank> I think I marked it Invalid after that
[15:15] <juliank> But some loads take ages
[15:15] <juliank> Let me set it back
[15:15] <vorlon> oh ok. also I lied I marked it invalid not wontfix ;)
[15:16] <juliank> heh
[15:16] <juliank> Anyway
[15:16] <juliank> bug 2060326
[15:16] <juliank> See ubottu has trouble too
[15:16] <juliank> bug 2060326
[15:16] <juliank> bug 2060326
[15:16] <juliank> " unattended-upgrades is running forever "
[15:16] <juliank> probably a duplicate of Brian's bug
[15:17] <vorlon> NOW launchpad is unresponsive for me
[15:17] <juliank> oh sorry it says " unnattended upgrades stuck burning 100% cpu "
[15:17] <vorlon> we should take it
[15:18] <vorlon> and if we figure out it's a dupe, ok
[15:18] <juliank> I just mark it as a dupe, it quite clearly is one and we can dedup later
[15:18] <juliank> but we need to get needs information
[15:18] <vorlon> ok
[15:20] <juliank> mm has nothing new, just the desktop bugs
[15:20] <juliank> #link http://reports.qa.ubuntu.com/reports/rls-mgr/rls-jj-incoming-bug-tasks.html#foundations-bugs
[15:20] <juliank> bug 2058743
[15:20] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Bug 2058743 in systemd (Ubuntu) "systemd local DNS tests failing with timeout" [Undecided, New] https://launchpad.net/bugs/2058743
[15:20] <xypron> unattended-upgrades is really taking long time on embedded boards.
[15:20] <juliank> taking a long time != not finishing
[15:21] <xypron> hours
[15:21] <juliank> and we can relatively trivially make it a lot faster fwiw
[15:21] <xypron> I just dropped it for cron-apt running when I sleep.
[15:21] <juliank> We just don't use action groups right now, but neither do we use the new inhibit action group feature
[15:22] <juliank> i.e. a lot of time is spent after each mark_install() call for each upgradable package to figure out which packages are now autoremovable
[15:23] <juliank> The new API I need to expose then we can use it
[15:23] <juliank> or we just keep a continuous action group when we open the cache, though it might not be enough
[15:23] <juliank> (it has its own internal one?)
[15:23] <juliank> Anyway
[15:23] <juliank> systemd loocal dns tests failing
[15:23] <juliank> slyon was talking to smb on the bug
[15:24] <juliank> but nothing new there
[15:24] <juliank> And ff is empty so I suppose that wraps up bugs
[15:24] <juliank> I'll try to have a look at unattended-upgrades upstream status, the whole thing is weirdly still maintained by mvo
[15:25] <juliank> he released a 2.10 but it ftbfs
[15:25] <juliank> #topic Team proposed-migration report
[15:25] <juliank> #link https://ubuntu-archive-team.ubuntu.com/proposed-migration/update_excuses_by_team.html#foundations-bugs
[15:25] <juliank> vorlon: do migration or skip?
[15:26] <vorlon> we can do it
[15:26] <juliank> We can do grey items
[15:26] <juliank> :)
[15:26] <vorlon> oracular is open
[15:26] <vorlon> nah that's generally not a good use of time
[15:27] <juliank> well then fwupd-signed should be removed; nullboot I need to talk to gjolly if we can ship that for oracular now
[15:27] <vorlon> "should be removed" why?
[15:27] <juliank> and software-properties I guess needs retries
[15:27] <vorlon> (can do, just want to know the reason)
[15:27] <juliank> vorlon: it was a wrongly uploaded rebuild of mine
[15:27] <vorlon> ok
[15:27] <vorlon> done
[15:28] <vorlon> ok so probably nothing to actually assign out here
[15:28] <juliank> vorlon: So software-properties needs to be force-skiptested because it fails with software-properties-qt
[15:28] <vorlon> yeah, will hint
[15:28] <vorlon> done
[15:28] <juliank> thanks
[15:28] <juliank> #topic AOB
[15:28] <juliank> That leaves any otter business
[15:29] <juliank> ð¦¦
[15:29] <Skia> wow, I had never seen an otter in my terminal yet
[15:33] <juliank> mkukri: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/grub2-unsigned/+bug/2057679 still needs verification
[15:33] -ubottu:#ubuntu-meeting- Launchpad bug 2057679 in grub2-unsigned (Ubuntu Mantic) "systemd-stub fails to boot when loaded via peimage" [Undecided, Fix Committed]
[15:34] <juliank> #endmeeting
[15:34] <meetingology> Meeting ended at 15:34:34 UTC. Minutes at https://ubottu.com/meetingology/logs/ubuntu-meeting/2024/ubuntu-meeting.2024-05-02-15.01.moin.txt

entry.content:
